solution_line_template: First find how much Mary pays weekly for the trash bins: ${cost_per_trash_bin}/trash bin * {num_trash_bins} trash bins = $<<{cost_per_trash_bin}*{num_trash_bins}={weekly_trash_cost}>>{weekly_trash_cost}
Then add this to the cost of the recycling bin: ${weekly_trash_cost} + ${cost_per_recycling_bin} = $<<{weekly_trash_cost}+{cost_per_recycling_bin}={weekly_total_cost}>>{weekly_total_cost}

Then multiply the week cost by the number of weeks per month to find the monthly cost: ${weekly_total_cost}/week * {weeks_per_month} weeks/month = $<<{weekly_total_cost}*{weeks_per_month}={monthly_base_cost}>>{monthly_base_cost}/month

Now subtract the discount and add the fine to find the total monthly cost: ${monthly_base_cost} - ${senior_discount_amount} + ${fine_amount} = $<<{monthly_base_cost}-{senior_discount_amount}+{fine_amount}={total_monthly_cost}>>{total_monthly_cost}
